stories.headline: Sweden and four countries confirm Russia poisoned Navalny
stories.summary: Swedish Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard announced that investigators have identified the poison used to kill Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny. She stated the poison could only have been administered whilst Navalny was in Russian custody. Moscow has rejected the allegations.

stories.headline: New evidence on Havana syndrome: Norwegian researcher builds sonic weapon, develops symptoms
stories.summary: A Norwegian researcher who was sceptical of Havana syndrome constructed a sonic weapon to test the theory, subsequently experiencing symptoms consistent with the condition. This may provide validation to symptoms reported by American diplomats.

stories.headline: Zelenskyy calls for EU ban on Russian merchant ships in Baltic
stories.summary: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy presented new demands at the Munich Security Conference, calling on the EU to ban Russian merchant ships from the Baltic Sea whilst continuing to push for Ukraine's EU membership.

stories.headline: Think tank: Russia's war effort suffering serious financial strain
stories.summary: The ISW think tank released a report indicating Russia's military apparatus is experiencing severe financial difficulties and heavy combat losses. Analysts suggest these mounting effects may eventually force Putin to consider actual negotiations.

stories.headline: Tension within Swedish coalition government over immigration policy
stories.summary: The Tidö coalition parties have publicly disagreed over migration policy. Sweden Democrats claim agreement has been reached, but the government maintains there are significant unresolved issues beyond surface details.

stories.headline: Gävle residents protest deportation of eight-year-old Gabriella Perez
stories.summary: The Perez family, including eight-year-old Gabriella, faces deportation from Sweden on Monday. Residents have gathered to protest, but immigration authorities have upheld the decision.

stories.headline: Sweden purchases new frigates to strengthen naval defence against Russia
stories.summary: Sweden is proceeding with a billion-krona purchase of new frigates to enhance maritime capabilities against Russian threats. Defence Minister Pål Jonson stated the deployment signals Sweden's commitment to territorial defence, though military analysts note the ships would likely become priority targets.

stories.headline: Swedish AI lawyer startup valued at 54 billion kronor
stories.summary: A Swedish artificial intelligence company providing legal services has reached a valuation of 54 billion kronor, reflecting growing investment in Swedish AI ventures.
